intro: Henriettea fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered henriettea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Henriettea fascicularis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity.
